title: Deity of Krishna vs deities of the demigods | Soulful Japa
speaker: HH Stoka Krishna Maharaj

segments.key_quote: Because the Devatas are living beings. They cannot be at multiple places at the same time while Krishna does not have such limits.
segments.summary: This segment explains the fundamental difference between the Deity of Krishna and deities of demigods, highlighting Krishna's unlimited nature and ability to be present in the Deity form.
segments.transcript: How are the Deities or Demigods different from the Deity of Krishna? Because the Devatas are living beings. They cannot be at multiple places at the same time, while Krishna does not have such limits. Yes. One thing, when it is Krishna, Krishna Deity body is Krishna's energy only. So for him, you know, to be in a Deity body is not an issue at all. He is present there and he can receive everything through the Deity, all these things.

segments.key_quote: Krishna says that one who, anybody who has faith in anybody, I am seated in their heart and I make that faith steady.
segments.summary: This segment discusses how the Lord facilitates demigod worship by empowering them and how demigod deities are images, unlike Krishna's deity which is non-different from Him.
segments.transcript: When it comes to the Demigods, the Lord Paramatma has given this special facility to them. Krishna says that one who, anybody who has faith in anybody, I am seated in their heart and I make that faith steady. So to facilitate this kind of even Demigod worship in this material world, the Demigods are given this power to know that there is a Deity of Ganesha being worshipped here. And then that doesn't mean that that Deity body is his. It is an image only. He knows it is an image. Image is different. Just like, you know, ordinary people, you take their photo. Photo is different. I am different. My photo is different. I am different.

segments.key_quote: But one who has got a spiritual body, there is no difference between him and his photo.
segments.summary: This segment explains that those with spiritual bodies, like Prabhupada, are non-different from their images, which is why their photos are worshipable, similar to how Krishna manifests in the Deity.
segments.transcript: But one who has got a spiritual body, there is no difference between him and his photo. That is why even now we keep Prabhupada's photo in the altar. Bhaktisiddhant's photo is in the altar. They are not photos. Because they have a spiritual body, they are non-different from that. They manifest in the substance itself. Just like Krishna manifests in the substance of the body. That is the Deity.

segments.key_quote: Devatas know that they are being worshipped in this temple, that temple, that temple.
segments.summary: This segment uses the analogy of a factory owner to illustrate how demigods are aware of being worshipped and are pleased by it, but their deities are not manifestations of themselves.
segments.transcript: But the Demigods cannot do that. Demigods will just know. Just like, you know, an ordinary man goes. He sees all his factory workers have kept one picture and they are worshipping. He is very pleased. Oh, you are worshipping me. Okay, I will give you a bonus. Devatas are like that. Devatas know that they are being worshipped in this temple, that temple, that temple. They know that their image is being worshipped. And therefore they are pleased with them.
